result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne Anthony Beaudin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

ADDRESS INFO for Wayne Anthony Beaudin
Current: 9199N Indian Trail Ave, c/o Michelle Beaudin, Hayward, WI 54843 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2021)
Prior: PO Box 1194, Hayward, WI 54843

I found the case file from Diane McNamer's file cabinet which had the Notice of Completion for Community Service signed by McNamer but was never filed into the case. Beaudin completed 154 hours of Community Service through WOJB and the order to forgive the balance of his fine was sent to Judge Winton signed on General Assignment. He will receive a refund for the money collected from SDC that we received - $946.49. and the remaining assessments will be modified as Forgiven.
Order to Forgive Balance of Fines - signed by Judge Winton on General Assignment
Community Service Agreement Notice of Completion - 154 hours

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wayne Anthony Beaudin in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:01 Pm Court calls case and recites appearances.  State amend count 1 of info to misd. poss. of THC plea of nc to be entered  - count 2 plead as charged and w/hold sentence 1 year probation with $100.00 fine plus costs.  Atty Hoffman and defendant agree with stmt by the state.  Parties stipulate to probable cause portion in complaint.  Court grants motion to amend count 1 to misd. possession of THC.  Defendant entered plea of NC to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Atty Hoffman this is a joint recommendation and makes arguement re: sentencing.  Defendant does not wish to address the Court.

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - fine/costs $100.00 plus costs - costs as to count 2 - counseling as may be deemed appropriate by DOC - 1 day credit if probation is revoked- may appeal and explains the process along with his rights

Defendant Wayne Anthony Beaudin in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Yackel.  DEF acknowledges Receipt of the Information.  Pleads Not Guilty, entered by Court.  DEF has 20 days for filing of motions/substitution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Wayne Anthony Beaudin in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Yackel.  DEF advised of rights.  Waives preliminary hearing.  State files the Information.  Hearing moves on to Arraignment.

Defendant Wayne Anthony Beaudin in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, NG to Misd by court,  waives time limit, but requests preliminary hearing,  bond continues  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 09:45 am.
